section.title: Global File Filters
section.para: This dialog lists the file filters available to all the project that use the default configuration, including the filters provided by plugins.

Filters used in the current project are displayed in bold. You can disable a filter by unchecking its box if you prefer not to translate files of a certain type. Their contents will not be displayed for translation.
To modify the file extensions and encodings associated to a filter, select it in the list and click the Edit... button.
Some filters provide a Options... button to further customize their settings.
Click the Restore Defaults button to reset the file filters to their default settings.
Modified file filter preferences are saved in , in the configuration folder. Vedere per i dettagli.
You can instead enable local file filters in . Doing so will put the in the project folder. See for details.

section.title: Modifica
section.para: You can double-click the editable fields to modify them, or instead click on the Edit... button to access a small modification dialog.
If you want to add a filter pattern, click on the Add... button to open a similar dialog.

The dialogs allow you to customize the filename patterns for the source and target files associated to this filter, and select their respective encoding. You can use the Filename Variables drop-down menu to customize the target file name.

section.title: Source filename pattern
section.para: To associate a filter to a file, OmegaT checks the file extension and attempts to match it to the source filename patterns in each filter.
For example, the pattern .xhtml registered in the XHTML filter matches any file with the xhtml extension. If such a file is found in the folder, the file will be handled by the XHTML filter.
You can change or add filename patterns to associate different files to a filter.

warning.para: Associating a file extension to a filter is not sufficient to have the filter properly handle the file. The file structure must also be compatible with the filter: even if you associate .odt to the XHMTL filter, the filter will not be able to understand the contents of a LibreOffice Writer file.

section.para: Source filename patterns use wild card characters : the “*” character matches zero or more characters, while the “?” character matches exactly one character.
For example, if you want to have the text filter handle readme files (readme, read.me, or readme.txt) you can use the pattern read*.

section.title: Source and translated file encoding
section.para: Most file formats allow various possible encodings. By default, the encoding of the translated file is the same as that of the source file. The source and target encoding fields use drop-down menus listing all supported encodings. Selecting the <auto> option leaves the choice of encoding to OmegaT, based on the criteria below.

listitem.para: OmegaT uses the encoding declaration in the source file, if present, to identify the encoding (HTML or XML based files).
OmegaT is instructed to use a mandatory encoding for certain file formats (Java properties, for example).
OmegaT utilizza la codifica predefinita adottata dal sistema operativo per i file di solo testo.

section.title: Nome del file tradotto
section.para: Files in the folder are overwritten everytime you create them, if they are created with the same name.
You may want to automatically rename the files you create, by adding a language code or a time stampe, for example.
The target filename pattern uses a special syntax. The easiest way to modify it is to use the Edit Pattern dialog. The dialog offers various options. A non-exhaustive list is presented below.

listitem.para: ${filename}—The default pattern. It represents the complete filename of the source file, including the extension. Using this pattern assigns the translated file the exact same name as the source file.
${nameOnly}— Inserts just the name of the source file, without the extension.
${extension} —Inserts the original file extension.
${targetLocale}—Inserts the target language+region code (in “xx_YY” format).
${targetLanguage}—Inserts the target language+region (in “xx-YY” format).
${targetLanguageCode}—Inserts only the target language code (“xx”).
${targetCountryCode}—Inserts only the target region code (“YY”).
${timestamp-????}—Inserts the system date time when the file is created. Various date and time patterns are available.
See the Oracle documentation for examples of the SimpleDateFormat patterns.
${system-os-name}—Inserts the name of operating system used to create the file.
${system-user-name}—Inserts the user’s login name.
${system-host-name}—Inserts the host name assigned to the system.
${file-source-encoding}—Inserts the encoding of the source file.
${file-target-encoding}—Inserts the encoding of the target file.
${targetLocaleLCID}—Inserts the Microsoft target locale.

section.para: For a source file named Document.xx.docx, using the variable variants below will produce the following results:

listitem.para: ${nameOnly-0}: Document
${nameOnly-1}: Document.xx
${nameOnly-2}: Document.xx.docx
${extension-0}: docx
${extension-1}: xx.docx
${extension-2}: Document.xx.docx

section.title: Language rules
section.para: Only the rules associated to language patterns that correspond to the source language of your project are applied. See in .

For example, for a translation from Japanese, only the rule set associated to the JA.* pattern and the rule sets associated to the .* patterns (those are generic patterns that apply to all languages) will be taken into account.
When you click on a language pattern in the top half of the dialog, a list of associated rules will be displayed in the bottom half of the dialog.

All segmentation rule sets for a matching language pattern are active and are applied in order. Rules for specific language regions should be higher than default ones. For example, the rules for FR-CA should be set higher than those for FR.*, which should themselves be higher than the generic .* set. Thus, when translating from Canadian French the rules for Canadian French—if any—will apply first, followed by the rules for French and lastly, by the generic rules.
If you want to create an empty set of rules for a new language pattern click the Add button.

An empty line will appear at the bottom of the table. Change the name of the rule set and the language pattern to the desired label and corresponding pattern. The language pattern is a regular expression. Use the Move Up button to set the rule set priority.

warning.para: Exception rules should be listed above break rules

listitem.para: Specify text combinations that are exceptions to a break rule. For example, Mrs. Dalloway should not be split in two segments even though a break rule for period followed by a space generally defines a sentence.
To define an exception rule, leave the Break/Exception check box unchecked.
Separa il testo di origine in segmenti. For example, period followed by a space generally defines a sentence end in English.
To define a rule as a break rule, check the Break/Exception box.

varlistentry.term: Tenta di convertire i numeri quando si inserisce una concordanza parziale (fuzzy)

listitem.para: If this option is checked, OmegaT attempts to convert the numbers in the fuzzy matches according to the source contents when a fuzzy match is inserted either manually or automatically. Esistono alcune limitazioni:
The source segment and the fuzzy matches must contain the same list of numbers.
I numeri devono essere esattamente gli stessi tra le concordanze di partenza e quelle di destinazione.
Only integers and simple floats (using the period as a decimal character, e.g., 5.4, but not 5,4 or 54E-01) are considered.

The documents to translate may contain trademarks, names, or other proper nouns that will remain the same in the translated versions. There are two strategies to handle segments containing only such unchanging text.

Si può decidere di non tradurre proprio tali segmenti. OmegaT segnalerà dunque questi segmenti come "non tradotti". This is the default approach. L'alternativa è inserire una traduzione identica al testo di origine. OmegaT can be set to recognize such entries by selecting this option.

section.para: Contains various options for changing how the text or modification information is displayed.

varlistentry.term: Includi il primo segmento non univoco quando evidenzi i segmenti non univoci

listitem.para: Check this option to display all non-unique segments (repetitions) in light gray. If left unchecked, the second and subsequent non-unique segments are shown in gray.
Allows the user to select the interval—in minutes and seconds—between automatic project saves.
Cambiare l'intervallo predefinito (3 minuti) a seconda delle esigenze per il progetto:
Short intervals (minimum: 10 seconds) for projects synchronized on an internal server.
Long intervals for team projects hosted on external servers.
Specify commands to run after using the command.
An example use of this feature would be to send translated documents automatically to the client's FTP server.
Use the various template variables to write your command

varlistentry.term: Permetti anche i comandi esterni per progetto

listitem.para: By default, OmegaT does not execute commands specified in the project-specific settings (the omegat.project file), because they could have a critical impact on system security.
Only activate this option if you know what you are doing, and can trust the source of the project.

section.title: Accesso proxy
section.para: Se, per accedere a Internet, OmegaT ha necessità di utilizzare un server proxy autenticato, immettere qui i dettagli forniti dall'amministratore di rete.

section.title: Memorizzazione sicura
section.para: This option lets you define or reset the master password used to protect login details and access keys for machine translation services. Always make a backup of that information before creating a new password, because they will all be deleted and have to be re-entered.

section.title: Plugin
section.para: This option shows a list of available plugins. Plugins are installed either in the folder under the OmegaT , or in the platform-specific OmegaT .
Additional plugins can be found on the OmegaT development site.

section.title: Aggiornamenti
section.para: Use this option to choose whether to be automatically notified of updates to OmegaT.
